string-array.name: intermediate_spanish
string-array.item: "Cause, give rise to, lead to, result in, bring about, create"
"Overused, overdone, overworked, worn out, timeworn, platitudinous"
"Risky, dangerous, unsafe, perilous, precarious, fraught with danger"
"Pecking order, order, ranking, chain of command, grading, gradation"
"Terror, fear, fright, alarm, panic; dread, trepidation"
"Indistinguishable, (exactly) the same, uniform, twin, duplicate, interchangeable"
"Decorate, adorn, ornament, accompany, embellish; add pictures/drawings to"
"Have a negative effect on, damage, harm, diminish, reduce, weaken"
"Insinuate, suggest, hint (at), intimate, say indirectly, indicate"
"Foist, force, inflict, press, urge; informalsaddle someone with"
"Make poor, make penniless, reduce to penury, bankrupt, beggar, ruin, bring to ruin"
"Inducement, motivation, motive, reason, stimulus, stimulant, spur"
"Stir up, whip up, encourage, fan the flames of, stoke up, fuel"
"Incontrovertible, incontestable, undeniable, irrefutable, beyond dispute, unassailable"
"Blown-up, aerated, filled, puffed up/out, pumped up; distended"
"Impede, hinder, hamper, hold back, discourage, interfere with"
"Intercede, involve oneself, get involved, interpose oneself, step in; mediate"
"Inquire into, look into, go into, probe, explore, scrutinize"
"Specialized language, slang, cant, idiom, argot, patter"
"Together, in partnership, in cooperation, cooperatively, in conjunction, in collaboration"
"Fall behind, straggle, fall back, trail (behind), hang back, not keep pace"
"Satirize, mock, ridicule, make fun of, caricature, burlesque"
"Wary, cautious, careful, guarded, chary, suspicious, distrustful"
"Valid, sound, well founded, justifiable, reasonable, sensible"
"Probable, distinctly possible, to be expected, odds-on, possible, plausible"
"Preserve, conserve, keep, retain, keep going, keep alive"
"Control, influence, use/turn to one's advantage, exploit, maneuver, engineer"
"Repair, fix, put back together, piece together, restore; sew (up)"
"Procedure, technique, system, practice, routine, modus operandi"
"Relocate, resettle, move (house); immigrate; emigrate, go abroad, go overseas"
"Lowest level, lower limit, bottom level, rock bottom, nadir; least"
"Do what someone says, carry out someone's orders; submit to, defer to, bow to"
"Get, acquire, come by, secure, procure, come into the possession of"
"Clear, crystal clear, plain, plain to see, evident, apparent"
"Rival, adversary, opposer, (the) opposition, fellow contestant, (fellow) competitor"
"Pervade, spread through, fill, filter through, diffuse through, imbue"
"Continue, hold, carry on, last, keep on, keep up"
"Concern, relate to, be related to, be connected with, be relevant to, regard"
"Vote, ballot, show of hands, referendum, plebiscite; election"
"Commend, express admiration for, applaud, pay tribute to, speak highly of, eulogize"
"Go/come before, lead (up) to, pave/prepare the way for, herald, introduce"
"Exact, accurate, correct, specific, detailed, explicit, unambiguous"
"Go ahead, carry on, go on, continue, keep on, get on, get ahead"
"Offspring, young, babies, children, sons and daughters, family"
"Flourish, thrive, do well, bloom, blossom, burgeon"
"Summarize, sum up; restate, repeat, reiterate, go over"
"Advocate, endorse, commend, suggest, put forward, propose"
"Improve, better, make better, ameliorate, refine; alter"
"Augment, increase, add to, supplement, boost, top up"
"Turn down, refuse, decline, say no to, spurn; informalgive the thumbs down to"
"Free, set free, let go/out, allow to leave, liberate, set at liberty"
"Depend on, count on, bank on, place reliance on, reckon on; be confident of"
"Disgrace, discredit, source of shame, blemish, stain, blot"
"Begrudge, feel aggrieved at/about, feel bitter about, grudge, be annoyed at/about, be resentful of, dislike"
"Reconcile oneself to, become resigned to, come to terms with, accept"
"Withstand, be proof against, combat, weather, endure, be resistant to, keep out"
"Settle, sort out, solve, find a solution to, fix, straighten out"
"Limit, keep within bounds, regulate, control, moderate, cut down"
"Keep, keep possession of, keep hold of, hold on to, hang on to"
"Take back, withdraw, recant, disavow, disclaim, repudiate"
"Get back, bring back, recover, regain (possession of), recoup, reclaim"
"Stiff, hard, firm, inflexible, unbending, unyielding, inelastic"
"Revolve, go around, turn, turn around, spin, gyrate"
"Examine, inspect, survey, study, look at, peruse"
"Choose, pick (out), single out, sort out, take; opt for"
"Acute, very bad, serious, grave, critical, dreadful"
"Sanctuary, refuge, home, haven, safe house; harbor"
"Get smaller, become/grow smaller, contract, diminish, lessen"
"Notable, noteworthy, worthy of attention, remarkable, important, of importance, of consequence"
"Origin, birthplace, spring, fountainhead, fount, starting point"
"Scant, scanty, scattered, scarce, infrequent, few and far between"
"State, name, identify, define, describe, set out"
"Conjecture, theorize, hypothesize, guess, surmise; think, wonder"
"Lonely, companionless, unaccompanied, by oneself, on one's own, alone"
"Calm (down), pacify, comfort, hush, quiet, subdue, settle (down)"
"Master plan, grand design, game plan, plan (of action), action plan, policy"
"Sum up, abridge, condense, encapsulate, outline, give an outline of, put in a nutshell"

"Replace, supersede, displace, take over from, substitute for, override"

"Clear, crystal clear, see-through, translucent, pellucid, limpid"
"Unharmed, unhurt, uninjured, undamaged, in one piece, intact"
"Dither, waver, be indecisive, be undecided, be ambivalent, hesitate"
"Well founded, sound, reasonable, rational, logical, justifiable"
"Disappear, be lost to sight/view, become invisible, vanish into thin air, recede from view, dematerialize"
"Disparage, denigrate, defame, run down, revile, abuse"
"Droop, sag, become limp, flop; wither, shrivel (up)"
"Renounce, relinquish, reject, dispense with, forgo, forswear"
"Provide, supply, present, purvey, make available, offer, give"
"Commend, express approval of, express admiration for, applaud, pay tribute to, speak highly of"
"Relevant, to the point, apposite, appropriate, suitable, fitting"
"Assume, take, take on, take over, secure, acquire, seize"
"Reoccur, occur again, happen again, recur, reappear"
"Be sorry about, feel contrite about, feel apologetic about, feel remorse about/for, be remorseful about"
"Correct, check, copy-edit; improve, revise, emend, polish, modify"
"Get angry, become infuriated, be furious, be maddened, bridle, become indignant"
"Comment, say, observe, mention, reflect, state, declare"
"Tolerate, allow, stand, bear, abide, stomach, swallow, put up with"
"Immature, inexperienced, naive, green, as green as grass, born yesterday"
"Surrender, concede, relinquish, yield, part with, give up"
"Illusion, fantasy, delusion, dream, fancy, figment of the imagination"
"Carry out, do, perform, perpetrate, engage in, enact"
"Blend, mingle, combine, put together, stir, jumble"
"Identical, uniform, alike, like, the same, one and the same, equivalent"
"Become clear, become definite, take shape, emerge, form, materialize"
"Condescend, stoop, lower oneself, descend, think fit, see fit, deem it worthy of oneself"
"Finale, final scene, final act, last act, epilogue, coda, end"
"Requirement, prerequisite, need, indispensable thing, desired thing"
"Tyrant, dictator, absolute ruler, totalitarian, authoritarian, autocrat"
"Squander, fritter (away), misspend, waste, throw away, make poor use of"
"Fit in, go together, be consistent, agree, accord, concur"
"In love with, infatuated with, besotted with, smitten with, love-struck by, captivated by"
"Urge, encourage, try to persuade, adjure, admonish, press"
"Quip, witticism, gem, play on words, jest, pun"
"Vanishing, fading, evaporating, melting away, disappearing, diminishing"
"Epitome, perfect example, shining example, model, paragon"
"Extortionate, excessively high, extremely high, excessive, sky-high, prohibitive"
"Praise, applaud, cheer, commend, express approval of, approve"
"Confine, intern, shut up, lock up, incarcerate, imprison, jail"
"Beg, beseech, entreat, implore, plead with, appeal to"
"Call into question, challenge, question, dispute, query, take issue with"
"Indisputable, incontestable, undeniable, irrefutable, unassailable, beyond dispute"
"Inexpressible, indescribable, beyond words, beyond description, beggaring description"
"Front on to, look towards, be facing, have/afford/command a view of, look over/across"
"Inescapable, inevitable, bound/sure to happen, unpreventable, inexorable, assured"
"Nonchalance, unconcern, lack of concern, indifference, heedlessness, relaxedness"
"Tearful, weeping, crying, teary, with tears in one's eyes, close to tears"
"Reluctant, unwilling, disinclined, ill-disposed, not in the mood"
"Shirker, slacker, idler, layabout; informalskiver, lead-swinger; informalgold brick"
"Little bit, small amount, particle, degree, speck, fragment"
"Caustic, trenchant, biting, cutting, acerbic, sardonic, sarcastic"
"Dying, expiring, on one's deathbed, near death, near the end, at death's door"
"Self-assured, assured, sure of oneself, self-confident, positive"
"Slanting, slanted, sloping, at an angle, angled, diagonal, aslant"
"Get, acquire, come by, secure, procure, come into possession of, pick up"
"Turn into bone, become bony, harden, solidify, stiffen, rigidify"
"Fuss, fuss and bother, bother, commotion, trouble, rigmarole"
"Express approval of, express admiration for, applaud, pay tribute to"
"Easily understood, easily grasped, comprehensible, understandable, intelligible"
"Essence, essential part, main point, fundamental point, heart, substance"
"Hold forth, expound, declaim, preach, lay down the law"
"Greater importance, priority, precedence, pre-eminence, preference, superiority"
"Forbid, prohibit, ban, bar, disallow, rule out, embargo"
"Evangelize, convert, seek/make converts, bring to God/Christ, bring into the fold"
"Childish, babyish, infantile, juvenile, puerile, jejune, callow, green"
"Strong, muscular, muscly, sturdy, strapping, robust, mighty"
"Storyteller, teller of tales, spinner of yarns, narrator, relater, recounter"
"Teasing, good-humoured mockery, chaff, banter, ragging, badinage, japing"
"Reoccur, occur again, happen again, recur, reappear"
"Bawdy, indecent, risqué, rude, racy, broad, earthy"
"Wise, clever, intelligent, with/showing great knowledge, knowledgeable, sensible, sage"

"Faux pas, gaffe, breach of etiquette, impropriety, piece of indecorum, social indiscretion"
"Bad-tempered, ill-tempered, ill-humoured, angry, wrathful, cross, peevish"
"Turbulent, stormy, tumultuous, violent, wild, lively, heated"
"Novice, starter, learner, student, pupil, trainee, apprentice"
"Take offence, be offended, take exception, bridle, take something personally, be aggrieved"
"Imperturbable, unexcitable, cool, calm, collected, cool, calm"
"Magnanimous, kind, kindly, benevolent, beneficent, altruistic, charitable"
"Failed, without success, abortive, misfired; vain, in vain"
"Boast about, brag about, make much of, crow about, gloat over"
"Rue, accurate, correct, true to life, factual, in accordance with the facts"
"Very bad, dreadful, awful, terrible, frightful, atrocious, disgraceful"
"Abundant, copious, ample, profuse, rich, lavish, liberal"
"Comparable, parallel, similar, like, corresponding, related, kindred, matching"
"Precede, predate, come/go before, be earlier than, anticipate"
"Outdated, out of date, outmoded, behind the times, old-fashioned, archaic"
"Saying, maxim, axiom, proverb, aphorism, saw, dictum"
"Considerable, substantial, significant, sizeable, goodly, fair, reasonable, tidy"
"Obsolete, obsolescent, out of date, anachronistic, old-fashioned"
"Attribute, assign, put down, set down, accredit, credit, give the credit for"
"Increase, make larger, make bigger, make greater, add to, supplement"
"Alone, all alone, on one's own, in a solitary state, separately, singly"
"Be incumbent on, be obligatory for, be required of, be appropriate for, be expected of"
"Overwhelm, inundate, deluge, flood, swamp, snow under; bombard"
"Sully, tarnish, blacken, drag through the mud/mire, stain, taint, smear, befoul"
"Withstand, be proof against, hold out against, combat, counter"
"Prop, support, abutment, shore, pier, reinforcement, stanchion"
"Truthful, sincere, candid, frank, direct, open, forthright"
"Ntellectual/mental capacity, intellect, mind, brain, brains, brainpower, powers of reasoning"
"Unite, join together, combine, merge, fuse, mingle, meld, blend"
"Unity, togetherness, solidarity, bond, sticking together, continuity"
"Conspiracy, connivance, complicity, intrigue, plotting, secret understanding"
"Huge, massive, enormous, gigantic, very big, very large"
"Smug, self-satisfied, pleased with oneself, proud of oneself, self-approving"
"Amalgam, amalgamation, combination, composite, blend, mixture, mix"
"Good for, helpful to, instrumental in, calculated to produce, productive of, useful for"
"Deliberately ignore, overlook, not take into consideration, disregard, pass over"
"Scornful, disdainful, disrespectful, insulting, insolent, full of contempt"
"Problem, difficult question, vexed question, difficulty, quandary, dilemma"
"Worldly, worldly-wise, well travelled, knowing, aware, mature"
"Acceptance, belief, faith, trust, confidence, reliance, traction"
"Degrade, devalue, demean, lower the status of, reduce the status of, cheapen"
"Explode, deflate, puncture, quash, knock the bottom out of"
"Demolish, knock down, pull down, tear down, level, raze (to the ground)"
"Demean, debase, cheapen, devalue, prostitute, lower the status of"
"Assign, entrust, give, pass on, hand on/over, turn over, consign, devolve"
"Ridicule, mock, jeer at, scoff at, jibe at, make fun of, poke fun at, laugh at"

"Run down, tumbledown, ramshackle, broken-down, in disrepair, shabby"
"Strife, conflict, friction, hostility; disagreement, lack of agreement"
"Self-seeker, egocentric, egomaniac, self admirer, narcissist; boaster, brag"
"Economize on, skimp on, be (more) economical with, make economies with"
"Evade, avoid, get away from, dodge, flee, escape (from), run (away) from"
"Difficult to catch/find, difficult to track down; evasive, slippery, shifty"
"Decorate, adorn, ornament, dress, dress up, furnish"
"Imitate, copy, reproduce, mimic, mirror, echo, follow, model oneself on"
"Tempt, allure, lure, attract, dangle a carrot in front of"
"Elation, happiness, joy, joyousness, delight, glee, excitement, exhilaration"
"Fair, just, equitable, impartial, unbiased, unprejudiced, non-partisan"
"Agonizing, extremely painful, severe, acute, intense, extreme"
"Be obsequious to, be sycophantic to, be servile to, curry favour with, pay court to"
"Gala, gala day, garden party, bazaar, fair, feast, festiva"
"Struggle, thrash, thresh, flail, toss and turn, twist and turn, pitch"
"Weakness, weak point, weak spot, failing, shortcoming, flaw, imperfection"

"Obtain, get, take, draw, derive, extract, cull, garner"
"Slick, pat, neat, plausible, silky, smooth-talking, fast-talking"
"Crawl, creep, cringe, crouch, prostrate oneself, kneel"
"Imminent, at hand, close, close at hand, near, nearing, approaching"
"Watertight, waterproof, damp-proof, water-resistant, water-repellent, airtight, tight"
"Tongue-tied, lost for words, at a loss for words, unable to express oneself"
